1.text: Wash the lime under cool, running water.

2.text: Place your microplane above a cutting board at a 45-degree angle.

3.text: Gently push the lime across the surface of the microplane.

4.text: Rotate the lime to zest the rest of the fruit.

5.text: Collect the zest and place it in a small bowl.

6.text: Rinse the microplane immediately or leave it in a warm location to dry out.

8.text: Get out your cutting board and zester.

9.text: Pull the zester along the surface of the lime.

10.text: Rotate the lime and repeat the process.

11.text: Chop the strips of zest finely (optional).

12.text: Use this method only if you don't have other tools.

14.text: Place the lime on a cutting board and hold it with your non-dominant hand.

15.text: Position the vegetable peeler or paring knife.

16.text: Methodically peel the zest from the lime.

17.text: Trim the white pith from the zest unless using strips for garnish.

18.text: Chop the zest into small pieces (optional).
